metadata.title: CVE-2022-0487 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in rtsx_usb_ms_drv_remove indrivers/memstick/host/rtsx_usb_ms.c in memstick in the Linux kernel. Inthis flaw, a local attacker with a user privilege may impact systemConfidentiality. This flaw affects kernel versions prior to 5.14 rc1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1088.95').
